intro: Clematis vitalba var. simplicifolia, commonly known as the creeping clematis, is a deciduous vine native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale blue, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its stems are woody and often climb by means of tendrils, forming dense thickets. This variety is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in partial to full shade.
